_header: The bird of Hermes is my name
_description: George Ripley(?), alchemical rhyme accompanying illustration of bird on Ripley scrolls — one couplet

BodAshRol40.Transcription:
The Byrd of Hermes Is my namEating my winges too make me
                    Tame

CamFitz276.Transcription:
The brede of ermes is my nameetynge my wyges [sic] to make me
                    tame
CamFitz276.Note:
Single couplet beneath illustration of and eagle on a globe; follows
                        2623.

EDCPRS.Transcription:
The birde of hermes is my nameeatinge my winges to make me
                    tame
EDCPRS.Note:
One couplet; fifth verse on scroll, beneath preceding verse, with
                    heading, ‘The Red See I The Red Soll I Red Elixer Vite’
                    intervening.
EDCPRS.Editions:
McCallum,  R. I. 
             “The Ripley Scroll of the Royal College of Physicians of
                Edinburgh.” 
             Vesalius
         2:1 (June, 1996): 39-49: 39-46.
